profileAlternative.name: James McNellis
profileAlternative.headline: Principal Software Engineer at Microsoft
profileAlternative.summary: C++ maven. Systems programmer. Scotch connoisseur. Classical music enthusiast. Photographer. Principal engineer at Microsoft working on Time Travel Debugging.

aboutAlternative.text: C++ maven. Systems programmer. Scotch connoisseur. Classical music enthusiast. Photographer. Principal engineer at Microsoft working on Time Travel Debugging.

positions.title: Microsoft
positions.description:
I am a software engineer in the Visual C++ group, where I work on the development of C++ toolsets.

I frequently speak at conferences on a wide variety of C++-related subjects. Recent events include CppCon, Meeting C++, Pacific++, C++Now, ACCU, the Italian C++ Community Conference, ADC++, Microsoft TechDays, C++ London, Madrid C/C++, MUC++ (C++ User Group Munich), FRUG (C++ FRench User Group), and the Microsoft MVP Summit.

roles.title: Software Development Engineer II, Expression Blend

positions.title:
Title
Principal Software Engineer, Visual C++
positions.description:
I am a software engineer in the Visual C++ group, where I work on the development of C++ toolsets.

I frequently speak at conferences on a wide variety of C++-related subjects. Recent events include CppCon, Meeting C++, Pacific++, C++Now, ACCU, the Italian C++ Community Conference, ADC++, Microsoft TechDays, C++ London, Madrid C/C++, MUC++ (C++ User Group Munich), FRUG (C++ FRench User Group), and the Microsoft MVP Summit.

positions.title:
Title
Principal Software Engineer, Windows Debuggers
positions.description: I was a developer on Microsoft's Time Travel Debugging (TTD) reverse debugging toolkit. I designed the concurrent algorithms for efficiently replaying TTD trace files; these algorithms yielded 300x+ performance improvements over the prior implementation, and allowed us to scale to support trace files 100x+ larger.

positions.title:
Title
Senior Software Engineer, Visual C++
positions.description: I was responsible for the Microsoft C Runtime (CRT) and C Standard Library implementation. I worked on modernizing large legacy C and C++ codebases; developed guidelines for building maintainable, ABI-stable APIs using C++; and contributed to the design and implementation of numerous modern C++ libraries.

positions.title:
Title
Software Development Engineer II, Expression Blend
positions.description: I worked on the XAML designer tools for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and the integration of the Blend designer into the Microsoft Visual Studio IDE.

roles.title: Software Development Engineer II, Expression Blend

positions.title: Lockheed Martin
positions.description: I designed and implemented high-performance, real-time 3-D graphics software used for real-world terrain visualization and mission rehearsal. In addition to the work on the 3-D rendering parts of the system, I built several libraries for managing and querying databases of flight information.

roles.title: Software Engineer, TOPSCENE Tactical Terrain Visualization System (TTVS)
Associate Software Engineer, FCS Multifunction Utility/Logistics Equipment (MULE) Vehicle

positions.title:
Title
Software Engineer, TOPSCENE Tactical Terrain Visualization System (TTVS)
positions.description: I designed and implemented high-performance, real-time 3-D graphics software used for real-world terrain visualization and mission rehearsal. In addition to the work on the 3-D rendering parts of the system, I built several libraries for managing and querying databases of flight information.

roles.title: Software Engineer, TOPSCENE Tactical Terrain Visualization System (TTVS)

positions.title:
Title
Associate Software Engineer, FCS Multifunction Utility/Logistics Equipment (MULE) Vehicle
positions.description: I built real-time, embedded software for communications and user control of the vehicle, and supported field testing of the first vehicle prototype.

roles.title: Associate Software Engineer, FCS Multifunction Utility/Logistics Equipment (MULE) Vehicle

educations.title: The University of Texas at Arlington
